description: Euler totient function phi applied to the n-th squarefree number.
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The 12th squarefree number is 17 and phi(17) is 16, so a(12)=16.
mathematica: EulerPhi[ x ] if Abs[ MoebiusMu[ x ] ]=1EulerPhi/@Select[Range[200],SquareFreeQ] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 13 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) lista(nn) = {for(n=1, nn, if (issquarefree(n), print1(eulerphi(n), ", ")));} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 12 2015(MAGMA) [EulerPhi(n): n in [1..300] | IsSquarefree(n)]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 13 2015(Haskell)a049200 1 = 1a049200 n = product $ map (subtract 1) $ a265668_row n-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 13 2015
author: _Labos Elemer_
